overview_of_class:
This is one of the cornerstone classes of your production experience in the film department at NU. You'll be introduced to Super 16mm film via the Arri SRII. You'll master the bulk of the lighting and grip equipment in the cage. You'll learn about light, color, lenses, emulsion, and film stocks. As well, you'll review the Panasonic HPX.

In addition to the technical side of cinematography, you will begin to explore the artistic side of this art. You will expand on your work in 190 by examining framing and composition, light and shadow, and color as they apply to the moving image. You will work rigorously on your ability to translate meaning, story, and idea into image. As well, you will gain more experience in the collaborative process which is critical in the filmmaking arts.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Required Text: Cinematography: Theory and Practice: Image Making for Cinematographers and Directors 2nd Edition
Grip Kit: You will be required to purchase the list of equipment below for use in and outside of class. Approximate cost $25-40.
Leather work gloves to handle lights (these cannot be made of cloth, or rubber)
1/4" or 3/8" flat head screwdriver OR multi-tool (e.g. Leatherman)
Roll of 1-inch black gaffer tape
Roll of 1-inch white gaffer tape
Lens paper, or microfiber camera cloth AND lens cleaning solution
Can of compressed air AND air puffer/ lens brush
Flashlight (Maglite, or LED)
Vis-à-vis marker
Orangewood sticks
